title: Cyril Jonard
text:
Cyril Jonard (born 23 February 1976) is a French <a href="judoka">judoka</a>. He competes in judo events for the <a href="Visual%20impairment">visually impaired</a> and <a href="blindness">blind</a>. Jonard has <a href="Usher%20syndrome">Usher syndrome</a>; he is both <a href="deafness">deaf</a> and visually impaired. He competes against non-deaf judoka.
Jonard took part in the <a href="2004%20Summer%20Paralympics">2004 Summer Paralympics</a> in <a href="Athens">Athens</a>. He won gold in the men's half-middleweight category (-81 kg) when he defeated <a href="Japan">Japan</a>'s <a href="Yuji%20Kato">Yuji Kato</a> by <a href="ippon">ippon</a> within just a few seconds in the final.
He was subsequently awarded a <a href="knighthood">knighthood</a> in the <a href="L%C3%A9gion%20d%27honneur">Légion d'honneur</a>, the highest decoration in France, by French <a href="President%20of%20France">President</a> <a href="Jacques%20Chirac">Jacques Chirac</a>. He also received a personal letter of congratulations from President Chirac for his achievement.
Jonard <a href="France%20at%20the%202008%20Summer%20Paralympics">represented France</a> again at the <a href="2008%20Summer%20Paralympics">2008 Summer Paralympics</a> in <a href="Beijing">Beijing</a>, and won silver in the under 81 kg category, defeated in the final by <a href="Cuba%20at%20the%202008%20Summer%20Paralympics">Cuba</a>'s <a href="Isao%20Cruz">Isao Cruz</a>.
